text.tspan: Storage info stored with gear usage
Site: Application Overview -> Cartridge - > view current / editable
rhc app cartridge change-storage - a foo -c php-5.3 --storage=10GB
rhc app info (to display the quota limits)
Most up to date doc in li repo
Quota *USAGE* is not included as part of this design
rhc-admin-chk should have a test to confirm node quota matches what is stored in mongo
Gear Groups get different quotas but it impacts the gears themselves. This means that
in an application that has a load balancer (tier 1), php apps (tier 2) and a database (tier 3)
quotas could be set at a per tier level (tier 1 might have 2G, tier 2 might have 10). Every
gear at a given tier has the same amount of storage. If I say tier 2 has 10G, every gear at
tier 2 has 10G and thus, if I have 4 gears at tier 2, I'd have 40G of total storage at tier 2.
